intro: Pavetta viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important species such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
